questions.questionText: Who is the only character in 'Avatar: The Last Airbender' who can bend all four elements?

options.description: Prince Zuko is a skilled firebender, but cannot bend all four elements.
Toph Beifong is a master earthbender, particularly known for inventing metalbending.
Aang, the protagonist of the series, is the Avatar and can bend all four elements.
Katara is a waterbending master from the Southern Water Tribe.

questions.answerDescription: Aang is the Avatar and can bend all four elements: water, earth, fire, and air.

questions.questionText: What is the name of Zuko's sister?

options.description: Azula is Zuko's younger sister, known for her blue firebending.
Suki is the leader of the Kyoshi Warriors, not Zuko's sister.
Mai is an ally of Azula and Zuko's love interest, not his sister.
Princess Yue is from the Northern Water Tribe and not related to Zuko.

questions.answerDescription: Azula is the name of Zuko's sister, a powerful and prodigious firebender.

questions.questionText: Which animal does not exist in the world of 'Avatar: The Last Airbender'?

options.description: Platypus bears are a hybrid animal found in the world of Avatar.
Turtle ducks are another example of a hybrid animal in the Avatar series.
Sky bisons, like Appa, are the traditional companions of the Air Nomads.
Regular penguins do not exist in the Avatar world; instead, they have penguin seals.

questions.answerDescription: Regular penguins are not present in the Avatar world; the series features penguin seals.

options.description: Iroh, a former firebending general and Zuko's uncle, does not teach Aang earthbending.
Toph Beifong, a master earthbender and the inventor of metalbending, teaches Aang earthbending.
Pakku is a waterbending master from the Northern Water Tribe.
King Bumi is an old friend of Aang's and a powerful earthbender, but he is not Aang's teacher.

questions.answerDescription: Toph Beifong teaches Aang earthbending, helping him to master this element.

questions.questionText: What is the primary occupation of Sokka and Katara's father, Hakoda?

options.description: Hakoda is not a fisherman; he is a leader and warrior of the Southern Water Tribe.
Healing is an important skill in the Water Tribe, but it is not Hakoda's occupation.

options.text: Chief of the Southern Water Tribe
options.description: Hakoda is a respected leader and warrior, effectively acting as the chief of the Southern Water Tribe during the war.
Hakoda's role is more involved in leadership and battle, not in trade or commerce.

questions.answerDescription: Hakoda serves as the leader and chief of the Southern Water Tribe and is a skilled warrior.
